content.raw:
> it really looks like RGBD camera is used instead of RGB

The depth topic is showing up because it was being bridged, but there's nothing publishing to it. Pull request #231 removes that.
content.html:
it really looks like RGBD camera is used instead of RGB

The depth topic is showing up because it was being bridged, but there's nothing publishing to it. Pull request #231 removes that.

content.raw: OK, thanks for info. Is the "compressed" \(JPEG\) topic also available, i.e. `/X2R/camera_front/image_raw/compressed` … I guess that it was not otherwise the assert would not fail??
content.html: OK, thanks for info. Is the "compressed" (JPEG) topic also available, i.e. /X2R/camera_front/image_raw/compressed … I guess that it was not otherwise the assert would not fail??

2\) I wanted to update, just to remove any differences via `docker pull nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed` so now I have also image `c13591225f85`, but it fails to run on our remote machine :disappointed: 

`[Msg] Loading plugin [ignition-rendering2-ogre2]`  
`No protocol specified`  
`[Err] [Ogre2RenderEngine.cc:338] Unable to open display: :0`  
`No protocol specified`  
`terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::RenderingAPIException'`  
``what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(3:RenderingAPIException): Couldn`t open X display :0 in GLXGLSupport::getGLDisplay at /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ogre-2.1-debbuilder/repo/RenderSystems/GL3Plus/src/windowing/GLX/OgreGLXGLSupport.cpp (line 789)``

content.raw:
I suggest remove those images and then please try again with [Option 2](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub).

```
docker rmi -f c13591225f85
docker rmi -f 64777efadabf
docker rmi -f a02df5a609ea
docker rmi -f 7333d212818c
docker rmi -f 79ceec338706
```

docker rmi -f 64777efadabf
docker rmi -f a02df5a609ea
docker rmi -f 7333d212818c
docker rmi -f 79ceec338706

content.raw:
> Is the "compressed" (JPEG) topic also available, i.e. /X2R/camera_front/image_raw/compressed

The compressed topic is not currently available. You need to use `image_raw` for now.
content.html:
Is the "compressed" (JPEG) topic also available, i.e. /X2R/camera_front/image_raw/compressed

The compressed topic is not currently available. You need to use image_raw for now.

content.raw: @{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} why should I remove docker images which are working?!
content.html: @Alfredo Bencomo why should I remove docker images which are working?!

content.raw: Martin, it was just a suggestion based on your original post `The docker image is 5 days old`. However, if everything is working for you now, then you can disregard my suggestion. Otherwise, I suggest you install yesterday’s [new image](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub).
content.html: Martin, it was just a suggestion based on your original post The docker image is 5 days old. However, if everything is working for you now, then you can disregard my suggestion. Otherwise, I suggest you install yesterday’s new image.

content.raw:
@{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} the 5 days old image is working \(I mean at least starting\), so I do not want to drop it because the newer images so far fail for me \(but could be only my problem with remote machine\).

@{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} it is pity - we used compressed topic to reduce the logged stream, but up to now I am still not sure if we could use/access any files besides score log file after the simulation is completed?? If not then it does not matter but it will be hard to debug potential differences.
content.html:
@Alfredo Bencomo the 5 days old image is working (I mean at least starting), so I do not want to drop it because the newer images so far fail for me (but could be only my problem with remote machine).

@Louise Poubel it is pity - we used compressed topic to reduce the logged stream, but up to now I am still not sure if we could use/access any files besides score log file after the simulation is completed?? If not then it does not matter but it will be hard to debug potential differences.
